thread.title_full: Michelle Obama on MasterChef Junior: Former first lady will guest judge on the cooking show | Cairns Post

title: Michelle Obama on MasterChef Junior: Former first lady will guest judge on the cooking show | Cairns Post
text:
Michelle Obama will be a guest judge on MasterChef Junior Natalie Wolfe, news.com.au February 11, 2017 12:59pm 
THE Obamas are back from their well-earned Caribbean getaway and Michelle Obama is about to return to the public eye, in the most adorable way possible. 
Obama will return to television screens as a celebrity guest judge on the cooking show MasterChef Junior. 
The reality show, judged and hosted by the world-famous Gordon Ramsey, is enlisting the help of a number of celebrities to help ‘judge’ the pint-sized creations. media_camera Ramsay hosts and judges MasterChef Junior where talented pint-sized chefs are taught tips and tricks. 
As well as Obama, Martha Stewart and a number of the Muppets are also confirmed as celebrity judges. 
Michelle has always been an advocate for fighting childhood obesity especially during her time as First Lady of the United States. 
The Let’s Move! campaign was launched by the former First Lady back in 2010 in an effort to raise a healthier generation of US kids and created America’s first-ever national taskforce on childhood obesity. media_camera Obama was praised for her Let’s Move! initiative. 
Michelle’s stint as a guest judge on MasterChef Junior isn’t the first time she’s appeared on a cooking show. 
Obama also cooked out the front of the White House with celebrity chef Ina Garten on her show Barefoot Contessa. 
The former President and First Lady are slowly returning to the public eye after being in the spotlight for eight years. 
The couple spent a weekend at the trendy resort town of Palm Springs and then flew to Virgin chief executive Richard Branson’s private island in the Caribbean. 
Whether or not Michelle will be biased on MasterChef Junior remains to be seen. 
According to the Chicago Times , five of the kids competing in the cooking show this year are from Chicago, Barack and Michelle’s home city. 
The show, now in its fifth season, sees talented kids cooking against one another in the hopes of winning $US100,000 ($130,290).
